messages.subject: Re: Unschool blog?
messages.msgSnippet: There are tons of unschooling blogs out there - in my experience though, most of them have lots of family stuff on them since *everything* falls under
messages.messageBody:
There are tons of unschooling blogs out there - in my experience
though, most of them have lots of family stuff on them since
*everything* falls under unschooling. But it's nice to see the
perspective of unschoolers. Go here http://www.ringsurf.com/netring?
ring=Unschooling_Blogs;action=list and you will find a list of links
to some unschooling blogs. Also, some other ones I like are:
http://radicalunschooling.blogspot.com/,
http://www.findingme.typepad.com/, http://no-assembly-
required.blogspot.com/, http://www.sandradodd.blogspot.com/ ... there
are tons more, too many to name! If you start one, make sure to let
us know so we can check it out!


--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, Wildflower Car
<unschoolfool@...> wrote:
>
>
> I had a blog a few years back that I killed because I was posting
mostly to my family blog. Lately I have had a bug to start up an
unschool blog. It is really just for me to get some of the stuff in
my brain out onto paper, but somebody might read it!
>
> I was wondering if you have a an unschool blog. I was hoping to
poke around and read a little. Even if I never get around to doing my
own, I enjoy them for reading. And if I ever get a site up, I might
make a blog role.
>
> Thanks!
> Wildflower

messages.subject: Unschool blog?
messages.msgSnippet: I had a blog a few years back that I killed because I was posting mostly to my family blog. Lately I have had a bug to start up an unschool blog. It is really
messages.messageBody:
I had a blog a few years back that I killed because I was posting mostly to my family blog. Lately I have had a bug to start up an unschool blog. It is really just for me to get some of the stuff in my brain out onto paper, but somebody might read it!

I was wondering if you have a an unschool blog. I was hoping to poke around and read a little. Even if I never get around to doing my own, I enjoy them for reading. And if I ever get a site up, I might make a blog role.

Thanks!
Wildflower
